sentences.en: Ambrosch had got over his good spell long ago, and was always surly.
sentences.cn: 安布罗希曾好过一阵,可早就不是那个样了, 总是阴阳怪气的.

sentences.en: Frequently he was the worse for liquor, which made him surly.
sentences.cn: 他常常喝醉酒, 酒后脾气很坏.

sentences.en: He became surly and rude toward me.
He became surly and rude towards me.
Her manner offstage, like her manner on, is somewhat surly.
sentences.cn: 她台下和台上的举止如出一辙，都有些粗暴无礼。

sentences.en: I began to be a little surly with him.
If the directors are in a surly mood, you made them that way.
sentences.cn: 要是董事们心里恼火, 那也是你给惹的.

sentences.en: Jeanie followed her consequential and surly, but not brutal, conductor towards the rectory.
sentences.cn: 珍妮跟着这个趾高气扬、有点乖戾, 但不算粗野的带路人向教区住宅走去.

sentences.en: Robert leaned back in his chair quiet and almost surly.
sentences.cn: 罗伯特往椅背一靠,闷声不响,十分乖戾.

sentences.en: She was plain, spiteful, and surly.
sentences.cn: 她相貌平常, 为人刁恶, 性情乖戾.

sentences.en: That old man is rather surly.
The surly insolence of the waiters drove him into a rage, and he flung his serviette to the floor and stalked out of the restaurant.
sentences.cn: 侍者们粗暴无礼的行为使得他怒不可遏, 他将餐巾扔到地上,愤然走出餐厅.

sentences.en: The surly youth in an official's uniform who began stirring up the two bags.
sentences.cn: 那位穿着制服的粗暴无礼的年轻人开始乱翻她那两只旅行袋.

sentences.en: Tonight the surly bonds of earth seemed more surly than usual.
sentences.cn: 今夜,地面上的羁绊象是比往常更为险恶.

words.tran_cn: 不和蔼；粗鲁；险恶的天气；乖戾

trans.tran_en: Someone who is surly behaves in a rude bad-tempered way
